title: Lesson 88
paragraph: This lesson focuses on mystery and wonder, emphasizing enigmatic, cryptic, and elusive qualities.

words.meaning: difficult to interpret or understand; mysterious
words.example: The painting had an enigmatic quality that intrigued viewers.

words.meaning: having a meaning that is mysterious or obscure
words.example: He left a cryptic note that nobody could decipher.

words.meaning: understood by few; secret or mysterious
words.example: The professor’s lecture on arcane theories fascinated the students.
The manuscript was written in an obscure language.

words.meaning: difficult or impossible to understand or explain
words.example: The disappearance of the ship remained mysterious.
Her expression was inscrutable, revealing nothing.

words.meaning: seemingly absurd or self-contradictory but possibly true
words.japaneseMeaning: 逆説的な、矛盾しているように見える
words.example: It’s paradoxical that the more he learned, the less he felt he knew.
The solution to the riddle was puzzling at first.

words.japaneseMeaning: 計り知れない、不可解な
words.example: The depths of the ocean are unfathomable.

words.meaning: difficult to find, catch, or achieve
words.japaneseMeaning: 捕えにくい、理解しにくい
words.example: Happiness can be elusive for some people.
